title: 2020 Year in Review
description: My yearly flex under the guise of reflection. Here's a summary of everything I did in 2020 alongside a few things I learned along the way. The year's theme was the "Year of Doing"

title: AI Zero to Hero Week 1: Fear of missing out on the AI train and what I'm doing about it
description: I kept procrastinating learning ML because I either thought I was too late or not smart enough... Time to stop that.

title: Using ChatGPT on an airplane through free Whatsapp - ChatGPT Over Whatsapp (COW)
description: ChatGPT is pretty useful and I didn't want to give up access when I flew. Most airlines give messaging access for free... so ChatGPT over Whatsapp was born.

title: How Fast Inverse Square Root actually works
description: Learn how one of the most elusive algorithms in gaming history works using calculus, floating point binary representations, and computer memory management

title: How Fast Inverse Square Root actually works
description: Learn how one of the most elusive algorithms in gaming history works using calculus, floating point binary representations, and computer memory management

title: How I analyzed Mr. Beast sponsor data
description: Mr. Beast has hundreds of videos and it would be infeasible to click through all of them manually. So I built some automations to help me with my analysis. Here's how I did it...

title: My First Open Source Contribution
description: One of the things that I love about programming is that you can see a problem in the world and solve it. So when I found out that one of the apps I used on a daily basis was open source, I was pleasantly surprised

title: Piver - The reason TeX is on version 3.141592653...
description: You've heard of semver. You might have heard of zero ver. But what about piver?

title: Using ChatGPT to make a Pok√©mon theme of my favorite card game
description: ChatGPT is really great at some things but at other times, it's so incompetent that I feel like giving up

title: What to do when an airline website doesn't accept your legal name
description: Southwest usually has good customer service... but in this case it's completely broken, I can't fix it myself, and the company has no plans of fixing it

title: Test Post Please Ignore
description: Testing my first post using Gridsome + Vue.js for a personal website blog

title: First Post
description: The first post written in Markdown

title: When should you give up on a project that doesn't work?
description: I spent most of my free time after work over the last month working on a project and today I'm giving up.

title: Where are Mr. Beast's sponsors now?
description: These days it costs millions to sponsor a Mr. Beast video. But how much did he make in his early days and how much ROI did his early sponsors get?

title: Who actually even uses is-odd and is-even?
description: People love to make fun of Javascript dependency bloat by talking about packages like is-even and is-odd but that got me wondering... Who actually uses them?

title: Why are Hard Drives called "Drives"?
description: Punch card, floppy disks, compact discs, etc. They all focus on the form factor. So why are hard drives called "drives"? credits: Thumbnail photo by Stockio.com

title: Why does Mr. Beast cut out sponsors from his older videos?
description: Most YouTubers don't have the luxury of removing ads from their older videos but Mr. Beast sets his own rules. How does he get away with it and what else is unique about his sponsorships?
